tit.cmt: Fukuro-obi のハイフンを削除しました。

sen.j: 袋帯（ふくろおび）とは日本で用いられる帯の一種。
sen.e: Fukuro-obi is a kind of obi (sash) that is used in Japan.
The fukuro obi is a kind of obi (sash) that is used in Japan.
sen.cmt: Fukuro-obi を The fukuro obi に修正しました。
sen.e: The fukuro obi is a kind of obi (sash) that is used in Japan.

sen.j: 女性用では、幅はおおよそ30センチ（鯨8寸）ほど長さは4メートル前後。
sen.e: In the case of products for females, its width is about 30 cm (hassun of kujirajaku (a measure used in kimono-making)) and its length is about four meters.
In the case of products for females, its width is about 30 cm (hassun of kujirajaku [a measure used in kimono-making]) and its length is about four meters.
sen.cmt: (a measure used in kimono-making) を[a measure used in kimono-making] に修正しました。
sen.e: In the case of products for females, its width is about 30 cm (hassun of kujirajaku [a measure used in kimono-making]) and its length is about four meters.
Half-width (kujira yonsun (about 15 cm)) fukuro-obi is also on the market.
Half-width (kujira yonsun [about 15 cm]) fukuro-obi is also available.
Half-width (kujira yonsun [about 15 cm]) fukuro-obi is also available.

sen.j: 男性用では幅約10センチほど（角帯）。
sen.e: Its width is about 10 cm in the case of products for males (kaku-obi).
Its width is about 10 cm in the case of products for men (kaku obi).
sen.cmt: for males (kaku-obi) をfor men (kaku obi) に修正しました。
sen.e: Its width is about 10 cm in the case of products for men (kaku obi).

sen.j: 名前の由来は織りの技法（袋織り：二重織の一種だが、表裏の耳の部分が繋がり袋状の生地になる）からで、礼装や晴れ着の帯である。
sen.e: This name derived from the technique of weaving (fukuro-ori : a kind of futae-ori (double fabric); it is a sack-like textile whose selvages of right and wrong sides are sewed together), and it is used for formal dress and festive dress.

This name derived from the technique of weaving (fukuro-ori : a kind of futae-ori [double fabric]; it is a sack-like textile whose selvages of right and wrong sides are sewed together), and it is used for formal dress and festive dress.
sen.cmt: (double fabric) を [double fabric] に修正しました。
sen.e: This name derived from the technique of weaving (fukuro-ori : a kind of futae-ori [double fabric]; it is a sack-like textile whose selvages of right and wrong sides are sewed together), and it is used for formal dress and festive dress.

sen.j: この様に織り上げたものは本袋と呼ばれる。
sen.e: A textile that is woven with this technique is called honbukuro.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: A textile that is woven with this technique is called "honbukuro."
sen.cmt: honbukuro にダブルコーテーションを追記しました。
sen.e: A textile that is woven with this technique is called "honbukuro."

sen.j: この他、縫い袋（鯨8寸幅の織物2枚を重ねて耳を縫い合わせたもの）や、片縫い袋（鯨16寸幅に織り上げ、幅半分に折って、耳を縫い合わせたもの）もある。
sen.e: Other than the above, nuibukuro (the one that is made by sewing together the selvages of two textiles of kujira hassun (30cm)) and katanuibukuro (the one that is made by folding a textile of kujira jurokusun (60 cm) in half and sewing together both selvages) are also available.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Other than the above, nuibukuro (the one that is made by sewing together the selvages of two textiles of kujira hassun [30cm]) and katanuibukuro (the one that is made by folding a textile of kujira jurokusun [60 cm] in half and sewing together both selvages) are also available.
sen.cmt: カッコの中のカッコを () から [] に修正しました。
sen.e: Other than the above, nuibukuro (the one that is made by sewing together the selvages of two textiles of kujira hassun [30cm]) and katanuibukuro (the one that is made by folding a textile of kujira jurokusun [60 cm] in half and sewing together both selvages) are also available.

sen.j: 帯板を必要とせず（但し現代の着付けでは帯板を使うことがほとんどである）扱いも楽なため、現在は丸帯に代って礼装用の帯の代名詞となった。
sen.e: It has become synonymous with obi for formal dress since obiita (band plate) is not necessary in tying (however, obiita is normally used in contemporary kimono-wearing) and it is easy to handle.

It has become synonymous with obi for formal dress since obi ita (cardboard belt to stiffen the obi sash) is not necessary in tying (however, obi ita is normally used in contemporary kimono-wearing) and it is easy to handle.
sen.cmt: obiita を obi ita に修正しました。band plate を cardboard belt to stiffen the obi sash に修正しました。
sen.e: It has become synonymous with obi for formal dress since obi ita (cardboard belt to stiffen the obi sash) is not necessary in tying (however, obi ita is normally used in contemporary kimono-wearing) and it is easy to handle.

sen.j: 生地は綴織、唐織、錦、紗などで、文様も生地全体を覆う絢爛なものが多い。
sen.e: Tsuzuriori (figured brocade), karaori (Chinese weaving), nishiki (brocade) or sha (silk gauze) is used for material, and its patterns are a luxurious ones that cover a textile in whole.
Tsuzuriori (figured brocade), karaori (Chinese weaving), nishiki (brocade) or sha (silk gauze) is used for material, and its patterns are a luxurious ones that cover a textile in whole.
Tsuzuriori (figured brocade), karaori (Chinese weaving), nishiki (brocade) or sha (silk gauze) is used for material, and its patterns are a luxurious ones that cover a textile in whole.

sen.j: 裏は通常は無地になる。
sen.e: Plain textile is normally used for lining material.
Plain textile is normally used for lining material.
Plain textile is normally used for lining material.

sen.j: 尚、名古屋帯にも袋帯に匹敵する豪華なものがある。
sen.e: In the meantime, there are some Nagoya-obi which are as luxurious as fukuro-obi.
In the meantime, there are some Nagoya obi which are as luxurious as fukuro obi.
sen.cmt: Nagoya-obi, fukuro-obi のハイフンをそれぞれ削除しました。
sen.e: In the meantime, there are some Nagoya obi which are as luxurious as fukuro obi.
